title: Lag Issues
body:
Game i Just played, heres the info.  Could not maintain connection to the riot server at fairly equal intervals throughout the game.

Charter itself was not having any issues during the disconnections i had (could load up a competitors game and stream video while LoL suggested i didn't have a connection).  In the STL area.

happened at 2 minutes, at about 15 minutes, at about 28 minutes, and about 40 minutes into the game. (12-15 minutes).  Ping would start at 30, go fine for 10 minutes, then climb to 60, then climb to 120, then i would get 'attempting to reconnect' before hitting 500 ping and full stop.  I was able to watch people freely move and kill me between the tier 1 and tier 2 tower at 15 minutes while at 120-150 ping, and getting an attempting to reconnect notification.  

The first time i disconnected and reconnected locally thinking it was me.  then waited for about a minute and quit and rejoined to perfect ping.  every time it happened thereafter i could exit the game and re-enter to no connection issues whatsoever for a 10 minute span.

This is the first time it has happened in this way, and was not an issue in either of the two previous nights in which i had played.  Not going to risk playing through these issues further, but in case it's not an isolated incident to just me I thought i would give a heads up.

replies.body: Live in St.Charles and have the same problem please help. Charter is my ISP

http://i.imgur.com/fAiw8Bh.png
http://i.imgur.com/b6Iv83n.png

Sorry for my crude image posting skills, but this is the logs of the connection/packets.

In one case, i did not immediately disconnect, but did so after having attempt to reconnect stuck on my screen while watching someone else CS in the lane just fine.

In case #2, it went a bit hairy for about 30 seconds and then outright disconnected me. 

There are 6 or 7 logs from the game total that i could send in a ticket, but i think there's definitely something going on with Charter.  I'm being forced to watch jared (annie bot) play Brand until we get help, please save me!

Hey guys i live in St. Louis/St. Charles also using Charter. EXACT same issues. Ping spikes to around 200-220mms champion wont move but will auto attack creeps for like 20 seconds then ping will come down and everything is fine. Does this several times during a game.

I'm having the same issues. I'm on Charter as well but I don't have any issues with anything else internet related. 

When I'm in game I can type and it shows up fairly quickly but my ping shows 170-220ms and my character will just not move sometimes. Other times my character will move but at like 1-2 seconds behind the commands I give. 

The "Attempting to Reconnect" window pops up multiple times. 

The only thing that fixes it for a short time is Alt+F4 and pressing "Reconnect" then I'm back in the game with 46ms and everything is fine for a few minutes.

I get 33 ping and then randomly it spikes to 150, game becomes almost completely unresponsive, then it comes back in after a minute or two back down to 33 ping.  I have charter but live in Minnesota not St Louis.
I'm also in St. Louis and it's unbearable.  I can see things happening in game but have no control over my character for about a minute, then things are fine for a while...  It has to be charter.

Same thing here. Been happening the last few days. Mine goes from 25 to 150-200. The high ping lasts for about a minute the straightens back out. Also on charter. I've checked everything on my network during the lag spikes and everything indicates it's not on my end :/ If it has something to do with Charter I don't know but I've been using Googles DNS servers and still getting it. 
Edit: On a side not I did try the hextech repair tool and it didn't help.
Same issue, Few other friends that live near me in Wisconsn are having the same issue random dc etc

Same problems, on STL Charter, been going on for 2-3 days, WTF, unplayable

UPDATE: Called charter he said he has had multiple calls about it, but tried telling me it was all over the country.  I dont believe that for a second looking at this post.  Seems to be a problem with STL Charter only, meaning its a problem on their end.  This is gonna be fun waiting for a fix.

I'm having the exact same issue, STL area. Game loads fine, plays through to the first couple minutes and then my connection just dies for a minute or two. I am unable to use abilities or move, though in most cases (about 5-6 games strait starting about 4 days ago) I am able to see everything that is happening around me in real time (enemies playing as I sit helpless anf rather annoyed). I'm hoping its a bug in the latest patch or possibly a server problem that can be fixed, but until then, I dont plan on playing League again.{{sticker:slayer-jinx-unamused}}

Well, it probably has something to do with charter, but if it were charter versus the world (tends to be that way every 2nd or 3rd weekend *grumbles*) i think i would've caught wind of it by now.

was hoping for something that i could do on my end to fix it, seems i'll have to just wait and hope it gets better.
Same exact issue. I live in St. Louis and use Charter. I don't think it is Charter.
I'm having the exact same issues. Every so often my ping shoots up to around 150 and I can hardly move my champion. I'm also on Charter internet.
I'm getting the same issues with Charter as my ISP, but located in Tennessee.
I'm relativitly close to st. Louis and i also have charter and have these issues...

I tried everything listed on [this](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) page and I have never had this kind of issues either. This is kind of an ISP problem becauseI'm playing with friends on my wi-fi and we all have the same lag and "attempting to reconnect" problems. 
It started yesterday evening and did it again right now. It seems our entire internet connection just shuts off (web browser takes hours to load a page, etc..) but as soon as the game ends it all starts to work again, so my guess is that it's something on the last patch that interferes with some ISP. As I said in another post I'm in France, provided by Numericable.

I appreciate all of the detailed reports here, and the time taken to troubleshoot this together.  As a first step, some players may be able to outright resolve this through our [connection issues](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) guide.  In particular for some cases, the configuring dns section might help a few others if it's a routing problem with an ISP.  

If the guide doesn't help, reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) so our tech team can help out individually.  For this, download our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to gather a set of logs for context, and attach it to the ticket.  We will respond as soon as we can!
Still same thing here, just tried an aram. I'm in mid Missouri not St. Louis.
I'm having the same issue but I'm in Europe with (obviously) a totally different ISP
stl charter similar symptoms
For those who are in the same boat, I have put in a support ticket to hopefully get some attention brought to this issue.  I'll pass word along if they respond to that first.
also, it's unplayable and frustrating. sometimes screen freezes for couple minutes because of 500+ ping

I'm based in Melbourne Australia (Oceania) and getting INSANE lag spikes. I have never experienced this before, my net connection is stable in all other respects (streaming music and videos, browser navigation, etc) but something has gone horribly wrong with the LoL client or something, I don't get it.

Really hoping that Riot can provide some information on this soon.  It sounds like something that was triggered in the patch change that doesn't go well with Charter, and not something charter has done, given the timing of when it occured.

Still unplayable today.
Bump, Still getting these issues a day later. ISP is Charter and live about an hour away from STL, Missouri.
